definition: throughout time/from ancient times (up to the present)
extending all the way across/running all the way through
from ancient times up to now/throughout history

sentences.english: Building socialism in China is a cause that has not been happened before.
sentences.chinese: 在中国进行社会主义建设是亘古未有的事业。

sentences.english: The sun―on its ancient, unchanged path―was just growing bigger, and redder.
sentences.chinese: 那时，太阳循着亘古不变的路途正越来越大，也越红。

sentences.english: Praise be to the Lord , the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华以色列的神，是应当称颂的，从亘古直到永远。

sentences.english: This is a wonderful achievement without precedent in Chinese history.
sentences.chinese: 这是中国历史上亘古未有的奇绩。

sentences.english: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
sentences.chinese: 从亘古，从太初，未有世界以前，我已被立。

sentences.english: Praise be to the Lord , the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华以色列的神，从亘古直到永远，是应当称颂的。

sentences.english: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting, and to everlasting.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华以色列的神，是应当称颂的，从亘古直到永远。

sentences.english: YET EVEN IN his deathless state, the Emperor continues his eternal vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 即使在他的假死状态中，帝皇的警醒亘古依然。

sentences.english: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华以色列的神，从亘古直到永远，是应当称颂的。

sentences.english: Humanity is a river of light running from ex- eternity to eternity.
sentences.chinese: 人性是一条从亘古流向永恒的溢光流彩之河。

sentences.english: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth
sentences.chinese: 你岂不知亘古以来，自从人生在地。

sentences.english: As I looked, 'thrones were set in place, and the Ancient of Days took his seat.
sentences.chinese: 我观看，见有宝座设立，上头坐着亘古常在者。

sentences.english: They are unchanging, that's the heavenly sphere.
sentences.chinese: 它们亘古不变，那是神圣的领域。

sentences.english: Not any too many helplesses, already through ancient times ice-bound.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么太多的无奈，就已被亘古冰封。

sentences.english: Days and nights come up and go down with unfailing regularity, like the ebb and low of an infinite ocean.
sentences.chinese: 日月更替，亘古不变，就好比那无尽大海的潮涨潮落。

sentences.english: Censorship is history’s greatest enemy of art.
sentences.chinese: 审查制度是亘古之艺术宿敌。

definition: the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
Xuan Yuan, personal name of Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
Pangu (creator of the universe in Chinese mythology)
primal chaos/formless mass before creation in Chinese mythology/muddled/innocent as a baby
time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
to split heaven and earth apart (idiom); refers to the Pangu 盤古|盘古[Pan2 gu3] creation myth
